results.title: Straford video memories
results.creator_credit: John Straford, Frank Straford and Inala Video
results.brief_description:
Video memories of the Victorian west coast and bushfires in the north-east produced by the Straford family.
“Gone to blazes” contains footage broadcast by national and commercial TV channels during the course of the devastating bushfires that ravaged the Victorian north-east early in 2003.

results.title: Rabbit control. Part 2: follow up
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a programme designed to control the rabbit population and their adverse effects on farming. This episode, which is narrated by Maurie Fields, looks at fumigation, destruction of habitat, baiting and shooting with follow-up procedures to ensure successful control of rabbit populations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land

results.title: Rabbit Control [Part 1: Poisoning with 1080]
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program narrated by Maurie Fields shows the problem of pest control in rural Victoria, and the adverse effects on farming if rabbit populations are not controlled. Part 1 explains the proper steps and procedure in using the poison 1080, the various safety precautions, equipment and supplies and tidy up details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Conservation Forests and Lands

results.title: Kiewa catchment farm tree group: a community in action
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs. North Central Media Unit
results.brief_description: The Kiewa community formed a tree planting group to combat the problems of land degradation due to the impact of agricultural practices, the effect of tourisism in the area and erosion. This video shows how a small community in the alpine area of north-east Victoria, worked together to deal with an environmental problem.

results.title: Achievements in salinity control
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of salinity and its effects on irrigated agriculture. Explains the formation of the water table and the resultant salinity due to poor drainage and evaporation. Focuses on a number of strategies and research developments to combat the problem.

results.title: The Big Dry
results.brief_description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. This tape examines the effect of the drought in the Mallee region in terms of soil conservation. This area experienced severe soil erosion as farmers were forced to overgraze livestock, in particular sheep.
results.description: The 1982-83 drought in North- west Victoria and South Australia impacted heavily on the environment. results.title: Conservation management of the new Mallee parks
results.creator_credit: Dept of Agriculture, Sunraysia, Horticultural Unit
results.brief_description: The establishment of large National Parks in the Mallee have as their objective, the conservation of natural resources. As part of a conservation program, projects include revegetation to support wildlife and conserve the soil and pest control of noxious species such as rabbits. With its largely semi-arid climate, the Mallee, despite suffering from land degradation due to farming and livestock practices, is another of our natural treasures.

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.
